attributes.title: Science of Making Your Prayers Answered - So'ham Asmi
attributes.description:
In today’s Nithya Satsang (22 January, 2016) on Isavasya Upanishad verse 16, Paramahamsa Nithyananda propounds the glory of Prayer from the right context of SOHAM ASMI - Oneness with the Source – “Prayer just becomes you. When you pray to a deity or Guru, have this context – I am praying to the Source where you and me are one and the same. Oh the Source, where you and me are one and the same – Soham Asmi. I pray to you, you make this into reality.” Unveiling His own inner space, He reveals that His life is one long prayer with the context of Soham Asmi, indeed, I am HE. He shares a Tamil song, which resonates the sacred sentiments of merging, being lost in the Divine or Source – “I fell into the ditch you raised me into the peak, I fell into the flood you brought me the shore. Tell me where should I fall, so you will reach me to you?” The answer to this prayer is – Soham Asmi. This science of prayer is the ultimate way to make your prayers heard and answered, and to experience Oneness. 
pūṣann-ekarṣe yama sūrya prājāptya।  vyūha raśmin samūha। tejo yat te rūpaṁ kalyāṇa-tamaṁ tat te paśyāmi yo’sāvasau puruṣaḥ so’ ham asmi ॥ 16॥
